definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy

sentences.english: We will pursue our own ‘scorched earth’ policy’’ (Lewis, 221; 224).
sentences.chinese: 宣称我们将实行“焦土政策”。

definition: The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)
pinyin: shang4 you3 zheng4 ce4 , xia4 you3 dui4 ce4

definition: to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to apportion expenses, responsibilities etc/to demand contributions
lit. to cut all at one stroke (idiom); to impose uniformity/one solution fits a diversity of problems/one size fits all
red-letterhead document, an official document with the name of the issuing government agency printed in red at the top, circulated to relevant bodies
